title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples and to score the response.

General Considerations

The response must correctly articulate a defensible claim or thesis that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning.

For Task A, the response must make a defensible claim that establishes a line of reasoning as to whether or not a country should or should not join a supranational organization.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with one or two pieces of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence is relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task C, the response uses reasoning to explain why the evidence supports the claim or thesis, using one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task D, the response develops an opposing or alternate perspective using refutation, concession, or rebuttal.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]

The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]

The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]

The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]

The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]

The response accomplishes all five of the tasks set by the question. [NOTE: For students to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For students to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.]
